title: Picturesque Lake Tahoe obscured by smoke from wildfire
description: Seven Western states are under air quality alerts due to raging wildfires, which have forced thousands to evacuate and destroyed hundreds of homes. CNN's Dan Simon reports on some of the 92 large fires currently burning in the US.

title: Terry Crews pumps up 'AGT' crowd with 'White Chicks' dance
description: "America's Got Talent" host Terry Crews reprised his choreographed dance from the movie "White Chicks" set to Vanessa Carlton's hit song "A Thousand Miles."

title: See what Virgin Hyperloop could look like in the future
description: Virgin Hyperloop's aerodynamic pods could transport riders up to 670 mph. While the technology has a long road ahead of it, this is what the hyperloop could look like.

title: Aaliyah: 20 years after her death, we still wonder what could have been
description: Like so many who die young, Aaliyah is forever frozen in time -- youthful, beautiful and left with dreams unfulfilled.

title: Former CIA officer on possible Havana syndrome incident: This was no coincidence
description: Former CIA senior intelligence officer Marc Polymeropoulos joins CNN's Brianna Keilar to discuss the delay of Vice President Kamala Harris' trip in Southeast Asia. Harris' departure was delayed after her office was informed of a "report of a recent possible anomalous health incident." That term is how the government usually refers to the mysterious Havana syndrome that has sickened hundreds of US officials over the past few years.

title: OnlyFans suspends proposed ban on sexually explicit content
description: OnlyFans said Wednesday that it will suspend its upcoming policy change to restrict sexually explicit material, citing "assurances" it received that would allow it to be "a home for all creators."

title: Why Biden will end the final mission in Afghanistan in just 7 days
Why some US Capitol rioters are getting no jail time
description: When it comes to holding the January 6 US Capitol rioters to account, the Justice Department has plenty of tools in its prosecutorial toolbox -- and plenty of critics who have questioned whether they are prosecuting defendants to the fullest extent of the law.

title: Journalist: Taliban takeover is a 'huge victory' for Russia
description: Ekaterina Kotrikadze, news director and anchor at Russia's TV Rain, speaks with CNN's Bianna Golodryga on Russia's reaction to Afghanistan's fall to the Taliban and the realities of being labeled a "foreign agent" by the Kremlin.

title: Serena Williams to miss US Open due to hamstring injury
description: Twenty-three-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams will miss the final tennis major of the year, the US Open, so she can recover from a torn hamstring.

title: US concerned about 'very specific threat stream' from ISIS-K against crowds outside Kabul airport
description: Concerns about security around Hamid Karzai International Airport in Kabul have increased based on "a very specific threat stream" from ISIS-K about planned attacks against crowds outside the airport, a US defense official has told CNN.

title: The power of three: How Arnold Palmer, Gary Player and Jack Nicklaus revolutionized golf
description: They were golf's band of brothers. "The Golden Bear," "The King" and "The Black Knight" shared 34 major wins between them and irrevocably changed the sport they played.

title: Jacob Zuma appeals to public for donations to fight legal battles
description: Former South African President Jacob Zuma has called out to South Africans to support him with donations as he fights a series of legal battles including a wide-ranging corruption trial.

title: More kids are catching Covid-19
description: Fears are growing about rising Covid-19 infections among children as the United States is turning into a bellwether for other countries, some of which are preparing for a return to school without mask mandates in classrooms and access to vaccines for younger age groups.

title: Global trade is in disarray. It's still booming
description: The reopening of the world's third busiest container port in China is great news for global trade.

title: Taliban tell Afghan women to stay home from work because soldiers are 'not trained' to respect them
description: Fear is mounting for women and girls in Afghanistan after the Taliban told working women to stay at home, admitting they were not safe in the hands of the militant group's soldiers.

title: The world's third busiest container port is back but the shipping crisis isn't over yet
description: One coronavirus case was all it took to shut down a critical part of the world's third busiest container port.

title: Afghanistan's only girls' boarding school flees to Rwanda
description: Afghanistan's only girls' boarding school has evacuated dozens of students and staff to Rwanda, the president of the privately-run institution said Tuesday.

title: Mick Jagger leads Rolling Stones' tribute to drummer Charlie Watts
description: Mick Jagger, Keith Richards and Ronnie Wood have paid tribute to their Rolling Stones bandmate Charlie Watts, who died Tuesday at the age of 80.

title: 19,000 evacuated in past 24 hours, White House says
description: The Biden administration's evacuation efforts in Afghanistan have gained considerable momentum in recent days, now far exceeding the initial daily goals after a chaotic and disjointed start.

title: Real Madrid submit $188 million bid for PSG star Kylian Mbappé
description: Spanish football giants Real Madrid have made a €160 million ($188 million) bid for Paris Saint-Germain striker Kylian Mbappé, Spanish media reported on Tuesday.

title: Herschel Walker launches Senate campaign in Georgia
description: Herschel Walker, the former football star, announced his campaign for US Senate in Georgia on Wednesday, after months of speculation marked by both former President Donald Trump's public encouragement and some Republicans' rising concerns about the political newcomer's ability to win a crucial seat.

title: From swimming to cycling, Sarah Storey wins 15th Paralympic gold medal
What does it mean for the Pfizer vaccine to have full FDA approval? Our medical expert weighs in
description: The US Food and Drug Administration granted full approval this week for the Pfizer/BioNTech Covid-19 vaccine for people 16 years of age and older. This is the first of the coronavirus vaccines to receive full approval from the FDA.

title: Female Afghan robotics team members arrive in Mexico
description: Five women from Afghanistan's renowned robotics team arrived in Mexico on Tuesday, following the country's takeover by the Taliban.

title: The SPAC party on Wall Street is flaming out
description: The SPAC party on Wall Street is flaming out about as fast as it began.

title: Pinduoduo is giving its entire profit for last quarter back to rural China
description: One of China's biggest tech firms has pledged to hand over its entire profit for the last quarter to rural development projects in the country as Beijing steps up the pressure for wealth redistribution.

title: Afghan withdrawal leaves allies to face harsh reality of US departure from world stage
description: The sudden fall of Kabul and the Taliban's near-total takeover of Afghanistan has left many of America's long-standing partners wondering what will become of the values-based, US-led international order.

title: World's first crewless, zero emissions cargo ship will set sail in Norway
description: A Norwegian company has created what it calls the world's first zero-emission, autonomous cargo ship.

title: Premier League clubs will not release players for international games in red-list countries
description: The Premier League says its clubs have "reluctantly but unanimously" decided not to release players for matches in countries on the UK's red-list for the upcoming international break next month.

title: Japan gang boss sentenced to death after group members attacked civilians
description: A district court in Japan on Tuesday sentenced the head of a gangster organization to death after its members killed one civilian and injured three others, although there was no direct evidence he ordered the attacks, public broadcaster NHK said.

title: The superyacht concept with an infinity pool and open-air cinema
description: If you thought you'd seen it all when it comes to innovative luxury superyacht designs, this new hybrid concept may just prove you wrong.

title: China is encouraging couples to have more children. But there's just one problem
description: Faced with a worrying demographic crisis of its own making, China is encouraging couples to have more children.

title: See US base in Germany where thousands of evacuees are
description: Thousands of evacuees are temporarily being housed at Ramstein Air Base in Germany as they await a flight to a new life away from the Taliban-controlled Afghanistan. Atika Shubert has more.

title: New Zealand battles worst outbreak since last year as Delta cases rise
Global Covid-19 cases plateau after nearly two months of increase, WHO reports
description:
• More kids are catching Covid-19
• New Zealand sees worst outbreak this year 
• Fitness trainer declined vaccine. Stunning photos show what happened to him

title: Woman in Tennessee live streams flooding moments before being swept away
description: In a video streamed on Facebook Live, Linda Almond Bryant captured the flooding outside the Waverly, Tennessee, home she was in. Moments later, Bryant was swept away by the rushing water. CNN's Nick Valencia has more.

title: Women-led production company in Kenya empowers children with help from Lupita Nyong'o
description: "Let's 'technovate'!" is the phrase Super Sema says any time she comes across a problem.

title: 'It was so scary': American describes journey to Kabul airport
description: Salma Kazemi, an American who was in Kabul, Afghanistan, visiting family, describes the chaos she experienced as she escaped the besieged city.

title: Philippines' Duterte raises rivals' suspicions by seeking vice presidency in 2022
description: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte announced on Tuesday he will run for the vice presidency in next year's elections, confirming an earlier announcement by the country's ruling political party that was criticized by opponents as a ploy for Duterte to maintain his grip on power.

title: New name for Pfizer vaccine draws vicious online critique
description: It may save your life, but can you pronounce it? The Pfizer vaccine's new name "Comirnaty" is getting raked over the coals. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Fitness trainer declined vaccine. Stunning photos show what happened to him
description: Colorado fitness coach Bill Phillips is urging others to get the Covid-19 vaccine after ending up in the emergency room and losing 70 pounds fighting for his life from coronavirus. CNN affiliate KUSA reports.

title: CNN anchor spars with Ugandan Foreign Minister on human rights issues
description: One World's Larry Madowo challenges Ugandan Foreign Minister Gen. Jeje Odongo denial of recent accusations made about violations against human rights made by the government.
